title: Mean enough to be toxic
body:
I honestly wish that I would chill a lot more during games. Sometimes I am a little too demanding in some games; leading to cursing once or twice or calling people "wood" players and things of the sort. 

I honestly feel bad about that and wish I could apologize to each and every person. 

During my grind to Plat I am going to do my best to return the easy-going, fun jungle that helps everyone self. 

Everyone have a great night. 

                                           {{summoner:13}}

replies.body: How is that player not banned for their summoners name?

I've had instances where I've wanted to say some pretty mean things - usually because I was already having a bad day. The best trick for me is to type out whatever I wanted to say, and then just delete it. Sounds silly, but I feel way better after.
After seeing it typed out, you realize how silly you'll look saying it.

> After seeing it typed out, you realize how silly you'll look saying it.

Haha, exactly!
that moment when you thought you hit backspace but actually hit enter.
That's why you abbort with escape. (it's also faster than deleting)
I have also tried this, helps so much more than it seems.

Just... Don't... Type...

Once you can force yourself to not type (it makes me enjoy the game more when I don't type.) you can then focus on being more positive.

I'm 50-50... If no one is an ass to me or in general, I won't say anything bad or mean to the team... However, if I'm in a bad mood someone wants to speak up with their attitude... I'll rip 'em a new asshole every time... So I see where you're coming from.

Well most of the time I have no Chat awareness that really helps and it also helps that I so slow at typing that it isn't worth the effort generally though sometimes I do get a bit angry/frustrated at times but I am mostly quiet then too

My favorite thing to do when getting upset playing ?

Yell to my empty room ..." Stay behind your minions "  A running joke with a friend/ fellow player :))

I usually just rage a little on TS and then take a large breath.
Except when there is that one guy, that one guy that thinks that since he is already 0/3 he can wander around stealing camps from the jungler, feeding exp and gold to the other enemy laners, and being a dick to everybody just because he didn't get it way.

In that moment, I just have to type him the Eric Cartman song.

It's nice to see people making this effort, these pledges.  Good for you!  I hope you can accomplish this goal.  

Sometimes I get frustrated too, and expect too much from people...but then I have to step back and realize a) that while I want to win, it's still a game. B) Those are people too, and people make mistakes, or are just flat out not good at everything.  And them being not good at everything is okay, because I'm definitely not good at everything either.  That's what I try to keep in mind to avoid saying anything too harsh, though if someone's harassing one of my friends for no good reason, I will say some words, lol.
try complaining to other players around you verbally so don't let it out on your teammates. or try to say f*ck or something like that only, flaming really doesn't help at all.
